CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lillian Morton, 619 Central Street, San Francisco, Calif., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "I definitely think that they follow the minister more than the politician.  The ministers my not be as strong as expressing themselves as the politicians, but nevertheless the people follow them more."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillian Morton, wearing dark suit, light colored hat, earrings, two strand beaded necklace, and wristwatch on left wrist, standing on Liberty Avenue with May Building in background with sign that reads "Drugs", Downtown
